description: From Anglo-Norman agister (“to pasture for a fee”).

verbs.description: agist (third-person singular simple present agists, present participle agisting, simple past and past participle agisted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take to graze or pasture, at a certain sum; used originally of the feeding of cattle in the king's forests, and collecting the money for the same.
(transitive) To charge lands etc. with any public burden.
